entries.name: Overview
entries: {@filter Artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} (also called martial cantrips) are an addition meant to boost the power and variety of martial characters. They were specifically designed for classes that do not already have access to cantrips, and are meant to emulate cantrips in function and damage.

entries.name: Classes
entries: The following classes know 2, 3, or 4 artes starting at 1st level, and learn a new one at 4th level and 10th level. When a character who knows artes gains a level, they can replace one arte they know with another.
Optionally, if the DM wishes to provide more flexibility, a character who knows artes can replace one arte they know with another when they finish a long rest.

entries.name: Casting Time
entries: An {@filter arte|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} that has '1 attack' listed as its casting time can be used as part of Extra Attack or similar features that grant additional attacks (such as the War domain cleric's {@subclassFeature War Priest|Cleric||War||1} feature, or the warlock's {@optfeature Thirsting Blade} invocation), sacrificing one attack to use it as part of the attack action. You can use only one arte on your turn. For purposes of casting multiple spells in a single turn, using an arte counts as casting a cantrip.

entries.name: Arte Ability Modifier
entries: An {@filter arte's|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} ability modifier is Strength or Dexterity (whichever is higher). This sets the saving throw DC and determines what you roll when an arte calls for an arte attack roll. If an arte requires a weapon as a material component, the ability score used is the one used when attacking with that weapon normally. Cantrips that are on the list of artes count as artes and are subject to these rules. Your Artes save DC is listed below.
{@b Artes save DC} = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier

At your DM's discretion, you can use a different ability score to set your Artes save DC and Arte attack rolls if it would be more appropriate for your character concept (such as a monk who focuses on Wisdom instead of Dexterity, or an eldritch knight who emphasizes Intelligence over Strength).

entries.name: Components
entries: The material components of {@spell Booming Blade|TCE} and {@spell Green-Flame Blade|TCE} are replaced with 'a melee weapon' and no longer require a coin value. For purposes of satisfying an arte's material component requirement, a character with the Monk's {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} class feature, the {@feat Tavern Brawler} feat, the {@optfeature Unarmed Fighting|tce} fighting style, or a similar way to fight without weapons counts as armed with a weapon even while unarmed.
At the DM's discretion, if the game is meant to have a high-flying wuxia flavour, consider removing the weapon requirements and allowing all artes to be used while unarmed.

If an arte has a somatic component, then it can be performed with a held weapon rather than an empty hand. This means that artes can be performed while holding a two-handed weapon or while holding a weapon and a shield.
* Artes marked with an asterisk are originally cantrips and now have a casting time of 1 attack.
PHB denotes a cantrip found in the Player's Handbook.
PoTA denotes a cantrip found in Princes of the Apocalypse.
TCE denotes a cantrip found in Tasha's Cauldron of Everything.

entries.name: Multiclassing
entries: When multiclassing, learning new {@filter artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} are treated the same as learning cantrips when taking levels in classes that cast spells. Like cantrips, artes increase in power at higher levels based on your character level, not your level in a particular class.

Similarly, each class listed in the Classes section above learns new cantrips at their 4th and 10th class levels. Treat each of these classes as if they had an Artes Known column on their class tables, just like the Cantrips Known columns on many spellcasting class tables. If you have 1 level in fighter and 1 level in rogue, for example, you would know a total of 7 artes, and would learn a new one when you reach 4th level in either class.

entries.name: Adaptation
entries: If some {@filter artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} don't quite fit your campaign or if a PC wants to use them but none of them feel appropriate, then it's easy to adapt them by changing their names and damage type. Because cold, fire, and lightning are among the most-resisted damage types in the Monster Manual, they should generally be given the highest damage dice. The exception is if an arte already deals weapon damage, in which case it should have a low damage die, such as d4 or d6. It's rare for monsters to resist force, necrotic, psychic, or radiant damage, so they should have medium to low damage dice.

Artes are also relatively flavour-neutral and I encourage anyone implementing them to add their own flavour or change an arte's name. For example, if a barbarian character learned {@spell Parting Blaze|Artes}, the arte's fire damage could be described as a beastly claw made of flame that follows their weapon when they strike.

You can add extra flavour not just by renaming artes, but also by grouping them by style, damage type, or function. For example, perhaps movement-centric artes (like {@spell Storm Dance|Artes} and {@spell Parting Blaze|Artes}) were created by an elite infantry unit, or all lightning-based artes (such as {@spell Lightning Lure|Artes}, {@spell Second Surge|Artes}, and {@spell Storm Dance|Artes}) were developed by an order of warrior-priests who worship a storm deity, or all defensive artes ({@spell Blade Ward|Artes}, {@spell Booming Blade|Artes}, {@spell Flames of Punishment|Artes}, and {@spell Sword as Shield|Artes}, for example) belong to the signature style of a certain kingdom's royal guards.

entries.name: Feats
entries: The following feats can be an option for your players if you include artes in your campaign.

data.name: FAQ
entries: Q: Who is this for?
A: Mechanically, martial cantrips / artes are for DMs who want to give the players of martial characters more options in battle aside from just using regular attacks over and over again.
Q: What about the weeaboo fightan magic flavour?

A: Flavour-wise, it's for people who want to give martials more spice than 'normal guy with weapon and armour' -- that flavour could come from the heroes of real-world mythology (such as Cadmus, Bhishma, Beowulf, Roland, Cu Roi, Arash, Bedivere, Diomedes, and others), by video games and Japanese animation, by Chinese wuxia fiction, and many other sources of inspiration.

Q: I am a boring person who can't get it up unless my wizard elf game with monsters and magic takes place in a perfect recreation of historical Europe. Will you make mundane, non-magical versions of these special just for me, specifically?

A: No. If you want mundane non-magical versions of these martial cantrips, then make them yourself. Changing the damage types, flavour, and names of the existing artes to fit your tastes should be easy for you, since people like you have a lot of experience sucking the fun out of things.
Q: Are these considered magic, and therefore subject to rules regarding antimagic?

A: Only if it suits your game. The default assumption is that they operate on the same logic (being a type of magic) as other martial cantrips, such as {@spell Booming Blade|TCE}, {@spell Green-Flame Blade|TCE}, and {@spell Sword Burst|TCE}. If explaining these as ki instead of magic makes more sense for your setting, then do that instead.
Q: Isn't this overpowered?

A: Not only is it not overpowered, it's barely regular powered. Cantrip damage does increase overall damage output, but not by a significant amount, and none of these effects are especially gamebreaking. Their effects were modeled after existing cantrips, which are balanced around repeated use in consecutive rounds.
Q: but muh game balance

A: D&D 5e is already a grossly unbalanced game that heavily favours casters. At the levels that casters are opening rifts to other planes of existence, calling down lightning, transforming into elementals, creating undead, petrifying their foes, and controlling minds, a martial is attacking a third time, dealing one more die of damage on sneak attacks or smites, or getting access to spells that full casters had eight levels ago.

I promise letting martials use cantrips and cantrip-equivalents as part of their attack actions isn't going to break your game, it's just going to let the players of martial characters have more fun in battle.

entries.name: Overview
entries: {@filter Grand artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=Grand} Grand artes are an optional progression of {@filter artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand}. They are stronger than artes but have a limited number of uses between rests. Many classes already have multiple resources to track, so these rules may not be a good fit for every game. If you consider a given martial class or subclass underpowered or lacking in variety and want to give it a boost beyond what artes provide, consider allowing a character of that class to use grand artes.

entries.name: Progression
entries: All classes that learn artes also learn one {@filter grand arte|spells|school=AR|subschool=Grand} at 5th level, which can be used once and cannot be used again until you finish a short or long rest. You learn a second grand arte and two total uses between rests at 9th level, and a third grand arte and three total uses at 13th level.

When a character who knows a grand arte gains a level, they can they can replace one grand arte they know with another. Optionally, if the DM wishes to provide more flexibility, a character who knows grand artes can replace one grand arte they know with another when they finish a long rest.
Grand artes also increase in damage with character level, gaining an additional die of damage at 9th, 13th, and 17th level. This is included in each grand arte's description.

spell.name: Berserker's Brand
entries: You channel a curse into your weapon that fills the target's mind with fury directed exclusively at you. Make a melee weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. This arte's psychic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@damage 2d6}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d6}).

spell.name: Binding Blade
entries: Your attack summons spectral chains that coil around your target's body and hold them in place. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and if the target is Large or smaller, it's movement range becomes limited. Until the end of the target's next turn, if it moves more than 15 feet from its space when this arte was used, it takes {@damage 1d6} force damage and is unable to move further.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Blade Ward
entries: You extend your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air. Until the end of your next turn, you have resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by weapon attacks.

spell.name: Booming Blade
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the arte's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly moves 5 feet or more before then, the target takes {@damage 1d8} thunder damage, and the spell ends.

This arte's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage to the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for moving increases to {@damage 2d8}. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 3d8}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Boreal Gale
entries: You swing your weapon and call down a wave of lethal frost on your foes. All creatures and objects in a 15-foot cube originating from you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Artes save DC or take {@damage 1d6} cold damage.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Cinder Surge
entries: Your weapon scatters seething, sparking motes of flame on impact, burning your target and anything near it. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal effects and the target and all creatures and objects except you within 5 feet of the target take {@damage 1d4} fire damage.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Clean Sweep
entries: You conjure a surge of water around you that crashes into your foes and forces them back. All creatures and objects within 5 feet of you, other than you, must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and be pushed 5 feet away from you. Each space within 5 feet of you is doused with 1 gallon of water that evaporates at the end of your turn.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).
At 11th level, the distance targets are pushed increases from 5 feet to 10 feet.

spell.name: Conqueror's Glare
entries: You focus your fury into an intimidating stare, assaulting a single enemy with only your battle aura. One creature you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your artes save DC or take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage and be unable to willingly move toward you until the end of your next turn.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Cyclone Surge
entries: You imbue your weapon with elemental wind, delivering an attack that slams your foe with a vicious gale. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and if the target is Large or smaller, it is pushed 5 feet away from you.

This arte's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the weapon attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage to the target on a hit. This arte's bludgeoning damage increases by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8}).
At 11th level, the distance the target is pushed increases from 5 feet to 10 feet.

spell.name: Flames of Punishment
entries: Flames fly from your weapon and surround your foe, floating menacingly around them, ready to strike if they dare to attack your allies. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and becomes surrounded by flickering flames until the start of your next turn. If the target deals damage to a creature other than you before then, the target takes damage equal to your arte ability modifier, and the arte ends.

This arte's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for attacking increases to {@damage 1d8} + your arte ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

scalingLevelDice.label: fire damage on attacking another target

spell.name: Green-Flame Blade
entries: You brandish the weapon used in the arte's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause green fire to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes fire damage equal to your arte ability modifier.

This arte's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the target on a hit, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to {@damage 1d8} + your arte ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

spell.name: Frigid Blade
entries: A layer of frost forms on your weapon and spreads onto your target when you strike, hindering their movement. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d8} cold damage. This arte's cold damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d8}).
At 11th level, the target's speed is reduced by 20 feet instead of 10.

spell.name: Knight's Litany
entries: You speak a prayer that infuses your weapon and your body with sacred light that bolsters your resistances. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and if the target is a worthy foe, you gain a {@dice d4} that lasts for 1 minute. You can roll the die and add the number rolled to an ability check or saving throw. Once the die is rolled, it is lost. You can only have one die from this arte at a time.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. This arte's radiant damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@damage 2d6}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d6}).

spell.name: Lightning Lure
entries: You create a lash of lightning energy that strikes at one creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward you and then take {@damage 1d8} lightning damage if it is within 5 feet of you.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Maledictor's Smite
entries: You speak a condemnation that ignites your weapon in black flame, which inflicts a curse that weakens your foe's resistances. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and the next time it rolls a saving throw before the end of your next turn, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from that saving throw.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage. This arte's necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@damage 2d6}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d6}).

spell.name: Ruinous Rime
entries: Swirling cold envelopes your weapon, spreading a numbing chill to your target when you strike. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and the next time it makes an attack before the end of your next turn, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from that attack roll.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d8} cold damage. This arte's cold damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d8}).

spell.name: Parting Blaze
entries: A billowing flame erupts from your weapon, obscuring your position from your foe. Make a melee weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can move up to 15 feet without consuming movement and without provoking an opportunity attack from your target.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage. This arte's fire damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d8}).
At 11th level, you can teleport up to 15 feet instead of moving.

spell.name: Razor Gale
entries: You channel immense power into your weapon and then swing it, unleashing a focused burst of force. Make a ranged arte attack against one creature or object you can see within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} force damage.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

spell.name: Second Surge
entries: Your attack infuses your target with deadly crackling energy that discharges when your ally follows up. You brandish the weapon used in the arte's casting and make a weapon attack with it against one creature or object. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and becomes suffused with lightning. The next time the target is hit with a weapon attack by any creature except you before the start of your next turn, it takes lightning damage equal to your arte ability modifier, and the arte ends.

This arte's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the initial weapon attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} lightning damage to the target on a hit, and the lightning damage on the second hit increases to {@damage 1d8} + your arte ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

spell.name: Sentry's Levin
entries: You infuse your weapon with lightning that jolts and staggers your foe. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal effects and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d10} lightning damage. This arte's lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d10} at 11th level ({@damage 2d10}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d10}).

spell.name: Shield Pitch
entries: You focus power into your shield to hurl it at your foe and draw it back to you afterward through will alone. Make a ranged arte attack with your shield against one creature or object within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage + your arte ability modifier.
Whether you hit or miss, your shield returns to you at the end of your turn. If your shield is magic, add its bonus to AC to this arte's attack and damage roll.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Shield Slam
entries: You focus power into your shield and deliver a decisive attack with it that leaves you in the perfect position to respond to a counterattack. Make a melee weapon attack with your shield against one creature within range. On a hit, your attack deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage + your arte ability modifier and the target has disadvantage on its next attack roll against you until the end of its next turn.
If your shield is magic, add its bonus to AC to this arte's attack and damage roll.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Shockwave
entries: You channel immense power into your melee weapon to create a devastating wave of force when you swing it. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Artes save DC or take {@damage 1d8} thunder damage.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Shrapnel Shot

m.text: ammunition or a thrown weapon, which the art consumes

entries: You charge your ammunition or thrown weapon with power beyond its physical capacity, causing it to explode and send fragments flying at creatures near your target. Make a ranged weapon attack against one creature or object within range. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and the target and each creature or object within 5 feet of it takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. The ammunition or thrown weapon is then destroyed.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Spirit Tether
entries: You conjure a chain of magical force between you and a foe and use it to pull yourself toward them, using the momentum to strike harder. Select one creature within 15 feet that you can see. You are pulled to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of your target, and this movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. You may then make a melee weapon attack against your target with the weapon used as this arte's material component.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's melee weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of your weapon's type. This arte's additional damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@damage 2d6}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d6}).
At 11th level, you instead teleport to any unoccupied space within 5 feet of your target.

spell.name: Storm Dance
entries: You close the distance to your foe and deliver a lightning-powered strike. Select one creature or object within range. You can move up to 15 feet toward your target without consuming your movement, but you must end your movement within your weapon's reach of your target. You may then make a melee weapon attack against your target.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's melee weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage. This arte's lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d8}).
At 11th level, you can teleport up to 15 feet instead of moving.

spell.name: Sword as Shield
entries: As you strike, your weapon leaves behind a trail of short-lived spectral copies that move on their own to block attacks. Make a melee weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and you deal an additional {@damage 1d4} damage of the weapon's type, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the additional damage + your arte ability modifier (minimum 1). These temporary hit points last until the end of your next turn.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Sword Burst
entries: You create a momentary circle of spectral blades that sweep around you. All other creatures within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} force damage.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Tailwind
entries: You summon wind to aid your movement, allowing you to either slip away from a threatening foe or smoothly step past their guard. You can move up to 5 feet without consuming your movement and without provoking opportunity attacks as part of using this arte, and can choose to do so either before or after you attack. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects.

Starting at 5th level, your weapon becomes surrounded by deadly winds that lash your foe. This arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} slashing damage. This arte's slashing damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@damage 2d6}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d6}).

spell.name: Thorn Whip
entries: You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee arte attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Thunderclap
entries: You create a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away. Each creature within range, other than you, must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} thunder damage.
The arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: True Strike
entries: You extend your hand and point a finger at a target in range. Your arte grants you a brief insight into the target's defenses. Until the end of your next turn, you gain advantage on your next weapon attack roll against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes an additional {@damage 1d8} damage of your weapon's type.
Additionally, your next weapon attack ignores the disadvantage from attacking a heavily obscured target.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Tundral Slam
entries: You stomp and spread a blast of cold that covers the ground in uneven patches of black ice. All creatures and objects on the ground within 5 feet of you, other than you, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} cold damage. Each space within 5 feet of you becomes difficult terrain for all creatures except you until the start of your next turn.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Void Fang
entries: Your strike forcibly teleports your foe, swapping places with you. You brandish the weapon used in the arte's casting and make an attack with it against one creature or object of Large size or smaller. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and you and the target teleport and swap locations.

Starting at 5th level, this arte's weapon attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage as the forced teleport painfully wrenches and rends their body. This arte's necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level ({@damage 2d6}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d6}).

spell.name: Waning Crescent
entries: You swing your weapon and create an arc of destructive ki that freely passes through enemies. All creatures and objects in a line 20 feet long and 5 feet wide must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d10} force damage.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

spell.name: Cocytean Gavel
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during this grand arte's duration, hellishly cold winds surround your foe, encasing them in ice, and the attack deals an additional {@damage 5d8} cold damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature of large size or smaller, it must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this grand arte can use its action to make a Strength check against your artes save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}. Additionally, if the {@condition restrained} creature takes any amount of fire damage, it is no longer {@condition restrained}.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 6d8}), and again at 13th ({@damage 7d8}) and 17th ({@damage 8d8}).

spell.name: Cometary Collision
entries: Your weapon thrums menacingly with accumulated potential. The next time you hit a creature of Large size or smaller with a melee weapon attack during this grand arte's duration, your foe is launched away as a deadly projectile. The attack deals an additional {@damage 4d6} thunder damage, and if your target is a creature of large size or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 30 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

Any creatures or objects in the target's path take {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage, or half on a successful Dexterity saving throw. If the damage exceeds an {@object Generic Object|DMG|object's hit points} and would destroy it (or destroy a section of it, if the target collides with a wall or similarly large object), the target continues through the object's space.
This grand arte's initial and secondary damage both increase by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 5d6}), and again at 13th ({@damage 6d6}) and 17th ({@damage 7d6}).

spell.name: Converging Echoes
entries: You call upon temporal shades of yourself from unrealized timelines to attack your foe, overwhelming their defenses with unavoidable simultaneous attacks from multiple directions. As part of using this grand arte, you make a weapon attack against one creature within range. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal effects. Whether you hit or miss, the target takes {@damage 4d10} damage of your weapon's type and is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. On a successful Constitution saving throw, the target takes half damage and is not {@condition stunned}.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 5d10}), and again at 13th ({@damage 6d10}) and 17th ({@damage 7d10}).

spell.name: Divine Battlecry
entries: You channel all your might into a supernatural shout that heartens your allies and leaves your foes rattled and disoriented. Each creature of your choice in a 20-foot sphere originating from you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} thunder damage and is demoralized for 1 minute. When a demoralized creature makes an attack roll or saving throw, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not demoralized. Creatures immune to the {@condition frightened} condition cannot be demoralized.

All allies of your choice within the 20-foot sphere gain temporary hit points equal to your character level and cannot be {@condition frightened}. If an ally is {@condition frightened}, that condition is removed for the duration. This grand arte is audible out to 300 feet.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 4d6}), and again at 13th ({@damage 5d6}) and 17th ({@damage 6d6}).

spell.name: Falling Star
entries: You infuse your body with cosmic flame and launch yourself at your foes, releasing the energy in a fiery conflagration where you land. Choose an unoccupied space within range. You jump in a straight line to that space without consuming your movement and without provoking opportunity attacks, provided you have clear line of effect to it. All creatures except you in a 20 foot sphere originating from where you land must make a Dexterity saving throw against your artes save DC. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage and {@damage 3d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.
This grand arte damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. This grand arte is audible out to 300 feet.
This grand arte's fire damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 4d8}), and again at 13th ({@damage 5d8}) and 17th ({@damage 6d8}).

spell.name: Maelstrom Blade
entries: Elemental energies surge forth as a devastating wave and linger on your weapon. You choose cold, fire, or lightning, and all creatures of your choice within 20 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Artes save DC or take {@damage 3d6} damage of that type, or half on a successful save. For 1 minute, one weapon you are holding deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of that type on a hit. This effect ends if you drop that weapon.
This grand arte's initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 4d6}), and again at 13th ({@damage 5d6}) and 17th ({@damage 6d6}).

spell.name: Magmatic Blast
entries: You channel fiery energy into your weapon and strike the ground, spreading that energy out where it explosively erupts and launches your foes skyward. Each creature and object in a line 60 feet long, 5 feet wide, and 15 feet high must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} fire damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.
This grand arte damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 5d8}), and again at 13th ({@damage 6d8}) and 17th ({@damage 7d8}).

spell.name: Ricochet Shield
entries: You infuse your shield with your ki and throw it, transforming it into an extension of your will that seeks out your enemies. Choose one target within range. You can then choose up to three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object, and can be targeted only once.

A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage plus your Artes ability modifier on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Your shield then returns to your hand.

This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the number of secondary targets increases by 1 when you reach 9th level ({@damage 4d6} and 4), and again at 13th ({@damage 5d6} and 5) and 17th ({@damage 6d6} and 6).

spell.name: Ride the Lightning
entries: You transform into living lightning and charge unhindered through your foes. You move up to 60 feet without consuming movement, you do not provoke opportunity attacks while moving in this way, and you can pass through creatures, but you cannot end your movement in a creature's space. Any creature of your choice whose space you pass through or move within 5 feet of takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage, or half on a successful Dexterity saving throw. A creature can only be affected by this grand arte once per turn.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 4d8}), and again at 13th ({@damage 5d8}) and 17th ({@damage 6d8}).

spell.name: Round Trip
entries: You imbue a weapon with your will and throw it, turning it into a deadly whirling trap for anyone foolish enough to draw near. Your weapon flies to an unoccupied space within range. For the duration, any creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of the weapon must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 2d10} damage of your weapon's type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

As a bonus action, you can move your weapon up to 30 feet. If you move the weapon into a creature's space, that creature must make the saving throw against the weapon's damage, and the weapon stops moving this turn. When this grand arte ends, the weapon returns to your hand. If you don't have a free hand to catch it, it lands at your feet instead.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 3d10}), and again at 13th ({@damage 4d10}) and 17th ({@damage 5d10}).

spell.name: Sea of Swords
entries: With a swing of your weapon, you manifest spectral swords that spin and slice and stab in all directions, from all directions, until there is no space that is not a sword. Each creature in a 30-foot cube originating from you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d6} force damage, or half on a successful save.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 6d6}), and again at 13th ({@damage 7d6}) and 17th ({@damage 8d6}).

spell.name: Spectral Phalanx
entries: You create spectral copies of a weapon you hold that whirl around you and attack in tandem with you. When a hostile creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it takes {@damage 2d6} force damage.
The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack on your turn while this grand arte is active, you deal an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage to your target.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 3d6}), and again at 13th ({@damage 4d6}) and 17th ({@damage 5d6}).

spell.name: War God's Wrath
entries: You channel all your fury into your weapon and swing it, devastating a wide area with rending shockwaves and whirling phantom copies of your weapon. All creatures and objects in a 60-foot cone take {@damage 4d6} damage of your weapon's type, or half on a successful Dexterity saving throw.
This grand arte has additional effects depending on the damage type of your weapon.

items: {@i Bludgeoning:} Any creature that fails its saving throw is also pushed up to 15 feet away from you from the incredible force of the attack.
{@i Piercing:} The speed of any creature that fails its saving throw is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn as it is pinned in place by spectral weapons.
{@i Slashing:} Any creature that fails its saving throw is also overwhelmed with pain and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

entries: This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 5d6}), and again at 13th ({@damage 6d6}) and 17th ({@damage 7d6}).

spell.name: Warp Strike
entries: Your weapon becomes both a focus of and a beacon for your ki, and you throw it unerringly at your foe. One creature or object within 120 feet of you takes {@damage 4d10} damage of your weapon's type, or half on a successful Dexterity saving throw. You then either teleport to the weapon's location or teleport the weapon back to your hand.
This grand arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 9th level ({@damage 5d10}), and again at 13th ({@damage 6d10}) and 17th ({@damage 7d10}).

spell.name: Illusionary Phantom
entries: You focus magic into your weapon to create a reflection of yourself next to you. The reflection is an illusion that will follow and copy your movements until the beginning of your next turn or you are attacked. The next creature that attacks you must make an intelligence saving throw against your arte save DC or else the attack will hit the reflection instead of you, causing it to deals {@damage 1d6} psychic damage to the attacker as it shatter.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Waterfall Crash
entries: You perform an overhead swing with your weapon while channeling water through it. As your weapon goes down the water flows in an arc toward a creature you can see within in range and the target must make a strength saving throw against your arte save DC or be knocked {@condition prone} and take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Lightning Blitz
entries: You sheath your weapon charged with lightning and ready yourself for a swift counter attack. When a creature you can see in your weapon's range moves or makes an attack, you can use your reaction to instantly unsheathe your weapon and make a melee weapon attack. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal effects and takes an additional {@damage 1d10} lightning damage.
You cannot make weapon attacks on your turn while this arte is active.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

spell.name: Corroding Coating
entries: A viscous green slime form itself around your weapon. Chose a target within your weapon's normal range, it must make a dexterity saving throw against your arte save DC or make contact with your weapon. While the slime soften the blow, the acid splashes onto the creature dealing {@damage 1d8} acid damage and softening its armor, lowering its AC by 1 until the beginning of your next turn as the acid loses its potency. The target's AC cannot drop lower than 10 + its dexterity modifier.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).
At 11th level, the AC drop by 2 instead of 1.

spell.name: Sonic Burst
entries: You concentrate air into your weapon and unleash it at a creature, the impact knock the wind out of the target and inflict tinnitus. Choose a creature you can see within range, it must make a constitution saving throw against your arte save DC or takes {@damage 1d4} thunder damage, is {@condition deafened} and cannot cast a spell requiring a verbal component until the beginning of your next turn.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Life Siphoning Strike
entries: Your weapon begins to emit a sinister red aura. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and if the creature is small or larger and is neither a construct or undead, you regain a number of hit points equal to your arte ability modifier (minimum 1) if it dies before the beginning of your next turn. While under this effect, the creature's wound emit the same aura as the weapon.

This arte's damage and healing increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage to the target on a hit, and the healing increases to {@damage 1d4} + your arte ability modifier. Both rolls increase by {@damage 1d4} at 11th level ({@damage 2d4} and {@dice 2d4}) and 17th level ({@damage 3d4} and {@dice 3d4}).

spell.name: Venomous Sting
entries: A dark green hue from your grip appear to slither toward the end of your weapon as you prepare to strike. Make a weapon attack as part of using this arte. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal effects and the target takes poison damage equal to your arte ability modifier at the end of its next turn.

This arte's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the poison damage increases to {@damage 1d8} + your arte ability modifier, and the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} poison damage at the end of its second turn after being affected by this arte. Both damage rolls increase by {@damage 1d8} at 11th level ({@damage 2d8} and {@damage 2d8}) and again at 17th level ({@damage 3d8} and {@damage 3d8}).

spell.name: Mantle of Mist
entries: You whirl your weapon around yourself as it grows cold enough to turn the air around you into a thick mist that follows you. The space that you occupy become heavily obscured. The cloud dissipates at the beginning of your next turn or after you make an attack or are attacked. While the mist is present, your next attack deal an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Shield Barrier
entries: You channel magic through your shield, projecting a defensive barrier around you. The barrier is a 5-foot sphere centered on you and moves with you until the beginning of your next turn. The barrier protect the creatures inside the sphere by reducing the next damage roll they would take by {@dice 1d4} + your arte ability modifier, after which the barrier fade.
If your shield is magic, add its bonus to AC to this arte's damage reduction roll.
This arte's damage reduction increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).
At 11th level, the barrier can affect two damage rolls before fading.

spell.name: Gravity Pull
entries: You charge your weapon with raw energy and unleash it above you in a pulse of black energy, causing the air surrounding it to be drawn to you. All creatures and objects within 10 feet from you but at least 5 feet away from you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and be pulled 5 feet toward you.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Field of Blades
entries: You plunge your weapon into a solid surface, such as the ground or a wall, within 5 feet of you for a second. The weapon can magically penetrate any material but doesn't physically affect or damage it. As your weapon enter the surface, several blades and spikes rise out of the stabbed zone. They fill a 5-foot cube area for the next minute or until you use this arte again, after which it returns to its original state. Any creature in the field of blades when you use this arte must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} piercing damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it moves into the space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Static Discharge
entries: Lightning begins to crackle around your weapon. Point at a creature within 15 feet of you with your weapon, the lightning jump from your weapon to the creature. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your arte save DC or takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage and loses the dexterity modifier bonus to their AC until they takes damage or the beginning of your next turn.
This arte's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

feat.name: Martial Scholar

prerequisite.other: The ability to use at least one arte

entries: Your breadth of knowledge of martial techniques allows you to adapt your style against any foe.
You gain the following benefits:

items: As a bonus action, you can learn any one {@filter arte|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand}. Once you do this, you know the arte until you finish a long rest. You can only know one arte at a time in this way.

feat.name: Swift Artes

prerequisite.other: The ability to use at least one arte

entries: You gain the following benefits:

items: When a hostile creature provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to to use an {@filter arte|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} rather than making an opportunity attack.

feat.name: Double Artes

prerequisite.other: The Extra Attack feature, The ability to use at least two artes

entries: You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use two {@filter artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} during your turn instead of one, but you cannot use the same arte twice and they need to be used on different attacks. The second arte does not scale, it is always casted as if you were level 1.

entries.name: Overview
entries: {@filter Artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} (also called martial cantrips) are an addition meant to boost the power and variety of martial characters. They were specifically designed for classes that do not already have access to cantrips, and are meant to emulate cantrips in function and damage.

entries.name: Classes
entries: The following classes know 2, 3, or 4 artes starting at 1st level, and learn a new one at 4th level and 10th level. When a character who knows artes gains a level, they can replace one arte they know with another.
Optionally, if the DM wishes to provide more flexibility, a character who knows artes can replace one arte they know with another when they finish a long rest.

entries.name: Casting Time
entries: An {@filter arte|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} that has '1 attack' listed as its casting time can be used as part of Extra Attack or similar features that grant additional attacks (such as the War domain cleric's {@subclassFeature War Priest|Cleric||War||1} feature, or the warlock's {@optfeature Thirsting Blade} invocation), sacrificing one attack to use it as part of the attack action. You can use only one arte on your turn. For purposes of casting multiple spells in a single turn, using an arte counts as casting a cantrip.

entries.name: Arte Ability Modifier
entries: An {@filter arte's|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand} ability modifier is Strength or Dexterity (whichever is higher). This sets the saving throw DC and determines what you roll when an arte calls for an arte attack roll. If an arte requires a weapon as a material component, the ability score used is the one used when attacking with that weapon normally. Cantrips that are on the list of artes count as artes and are subject to these rules. Your Artes save DC is listed below.
{@b Artes save DC} = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier

At your DM's discretion, you can use a different ability score to set your Artes save DC and Arte attack rolls if it would be more appropriate for your character concept (such as a monk who focuses on Wisdom instead of Dexterity, or an eldritch knight who emphasizes Intelligence over Strength).

entries.name: Components
entries: The material components of {@spell Booming Blade|TCE} and {@spell Green-Flame Blade|TCE} are replaced with 'a melee weapon' and no longer require a coin value. For purposes of satisfying an arte's material component requirement, a character with the Monk's {@classFeature Martial Arts|Monk||1} class feature, the {@feat Tavern Brawler} feat, the {@optfeature Unarmed Fighting|tce} fighting style, or a similar way to fight without weapons counts as armed with a weapon even while unarmed.
At the DM's discretion, if the game is meant to have a high-flying wuxia flavour, consider removing the weapon requirements and allowing all artes to be used while unarmed.

If an arte has a somatic component, then it can be performed with a held weapon rather than an empty hand. This means that artes can be performed while holding a two-handed weapon or while holding a weapon and a shield.
* Artes marked with an asterisk are originally cantrips and now have a casting time of 1 attack.
PHB denotes a cantrip found in the Player's Handbook.
PoTA denotes a cantrip found in Princes of the Apocalypse.
TCE denotes a cantrip found in Tasha's Cauldron of Everything.

entries.name: Overview
entries: {@filter Grand artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=Grand} Grand artes are an optional progression of {@filter artes|spells|school=AR|subschool=!Grand}. They are stronger than artes but have a limited number of uses between rests. Many classes already have multiple resources to track, so these rules may not be a good fit for every game. If you consider a given martial class or subclass underpowered or lacking in variety and want to give it a boost beyond what artes provide, consider allowing a character of that class to use grand artes.

entries.name: Progression
entries: All classes that learn artes also learn one {@filter grand arte|spells|school=AR|subschool=Grand} at 5th level, which can be used once and cannot be used again until you finish a short or long rest. You learn a second grand arte and two total uses between rests at 9th level, and a third grand arte and three total uses at 13th level.

When a character who knows a grand arte gains a level, they can they can replace one grand arte they know with another. Optionally, if the DM wishes to provide more flexibility, a character who knows grand artes can replace one grand arte they know with another when they finish a long rest.
Grand artes also increase in damage with character level, gaining an additional die of damage at 9th, 13th, and 17th level. This is included in each grand arte's description.
